intro: Liparia splendens subsp. splendens, commonly known as the splendour liparia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and attractive, spurred flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
